item.title: Azure Durable Functions in F#
item.description: Azure Functions are designed for stateless, fast-to-execute, simple actions. Typically, they are triggered by an HTTP call or a queue message, then they read something from the storage or database and return the result to the caller or send it to another queue. All within several seconds at most.

item.title: Custom Autoscaling with Durable Functions
item.description: In my previous post Custom Autoscaling of Azure App Service with a Function App I’ve created a Function App which watches a Service Bus Subscription backlog and adjusts the scale of App Service based on the observed load.
